DataElement.preferredName: Image Single Collimation Width 8 Byte Millimeter Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The width of a single row of acquired data (in mm). Note: Adjacent physical detector rows may have been combined to form a single effective acquisition row. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The width of a single row of acquired data (in mm). Note: Adjacent physical detector rows may have been combined to form a single effective acquisition row. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others.:A diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation.:The extent or measurement of something from side to side.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
A diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation.
The extent or measurement of something from side to side.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/21/09 Released for load of NCIAv4.4 model.  5/20/07-2007 DICOM Standard - Sections 3

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: FD MM: A floating decimal number that denotes: the sum of seven and one measured in one thousandth of a meter.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.:A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.:A unit of measure equaling one thousandth of a meter. (NCI):Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.
A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/21/09 created for UOM Specific VD for DICOM FD Value Representation type.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 6/21/09 created for UOM Specific VD for DICOM FD Value Representation type to load NCIA v4.4 model.   6/18/07- Edit for IE/Attribute structure; retire DEC created in NCIA 2.0 load;  3/22/07 - Assigned CDEs to DICOM-Review Set 1 CSI
